item.title: My yum aliases
item.description: I am using yum a lot. Everyday. Typing sudo yum -y is boring. Now, guess what. $ alias | grep yum alias ycu='sudo yum check-update' alias yi='sudo yum install' alias yli='sudo yum localinstall --nogpgcheck' alias ypr='sudo yum provides' alias yprw='sudo yum provides $(which $1)' alias yr='sudo yum remove' alias ys='sudo yum search' alias yu='sudo yum update' alias yut='sudo yum --enablerepo=updates-testing update' alias yyi='sudo yum -y install' alias yyr='sudo yum -y remove'
